content.formatted_body:
annevk: TabAtkins Sorry about the checker change breaking builds; going forward, I’ll try to make sure I don’t end doing something like that again. For now:

  • I’ve changed the checker messages about role=directory to being warnings rather than errors.
  • In https://github.com/validator/validator/commit/4cd3a20ef1 I added some automation that will now cause every single WHATWG spec to be checked under CI on every push to the checker sources

content.body: TabAtkins: If there are other specs you’d recommend I also add automated checking like that for, lemme know — I’d be happy to add more.
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: If there are other specs you’d recommend I also add automated checking like that for, lemme know — I’d be happy to add more.

content.body: And for the record, I’ll confess that if I had been following the ARIA spec requirements strictly/properly, the messages about `role=directory` should have warnings to begin with — not errors. That’s because the ARIA spec defines `role=directory` as just being deprecated — not strictly non-conforming.
content.formatted_body: And for the record, I’ll confess that if I had been following the ARIA spec requirements strictly/properly, the messages about role=directory should have warnings to begin with — not errors. That’s because the ARIA spec defines role=directory as just being deprecated — not strictly non-conforming.

content.body: But that said, for document/author-conformance requirements that I have to maintain code for in the checker, in general I really don’t like the pattern of specs redefining some feature as deprecated but then over time never ever getting around to eventually making them strictly non-conforming.
